member.name: DISCDLGSTRUCTA
member.summary: TheDISCDLGSTRUCT structure is used in the function. The structure contains required information for the disconnect attempt.

member.name: DISCDLGSTRUCTA.cbStructure
member.summary: The size, in bytes, of theDISCDLGSTRUCT structure. The caller must supply this value.

member.name: DISCDLGSTRUCTA.hwndOwner
member.summary: A handle to the owner window of the dialog box.

member.name: DISCDLGSTRUCTA.lpLocalName
member.summary: A pointer to a NULL-terminated string that specifies the local device name that is redirected to the network resource, such as "F:" or "LPT1".

member.name: DISCDLGSTRUCTA.lpRemoteName
member.summary: A pointer to a NULL-terminated string that specifies the name of the network resource to disconnect. This member can be NULL if the lpLocalName member is specified. When lpLocalName is specified, the connection to the network resource redirected from lpLocalName is disconnected.

summary.para: A set of bit flags describing the connection. This member can be a combination of the following values.

listheader.description: If this value is set, the specified connection is no longer a persistent one (automatically restored every time the user logs on). This flag is valid only if the lpLocalName member specifies a local device.

If this value is not set, the system applies force when attempting to disconnect from the network resource.
This situation typically occurs when the user has files open over the connection. This value means that the user will be informed if there are open files on the connection, and asked if he or she still wants to disconnect. If the user wants to proceed, the disconnect procedure re-attempts with additional force.
